title: New Holland Mhdrescher | Combine Harvester | Free to use 4K footage - creative commons

tasks.task: Operating a forklift on a farm.
subtasks: Sitting in the forklift seat.
Gripping the steering wheel to direct the forklift.
Looking around to check the surroundings while moving the forklift.
Adjusting the forklift's load capacity by using the forks.
Maneuvering the forklift to pick up goods.
Lifting the goods onto the forks using the hydraulic system.
Navigating the forklift through the warehouse or storage area.
Placing the lifted goods onto a designated area or vehicle.
Lowering the forks safely after unloading.
Inspecting the hay piles for safety.
Using a rake to gather scattered hay into a pile.
Driving a tractor to transport the hay.
Hitching a trailer or hay wagon to the tractor.
Operating the tractor to pull the hay wagon to the storage area.
Unloading hay from the wagon into the barn.

tasks.task: Trimming hay bales on a wagon.
subtasks: Positioning one's body near the hay bale to cut it.
Using a wire hog or similar tool to trim the hay bale.
Moving the trimmed bale to a designated area.
Stopping the wagon to allow another individual to unload.
Assisting in lifting hay bales from the wagon to the barn.
Passing hay bales to another person who is unloading.

tasks.task: Picking up hay with a skid loader.
subtasks: Operating the skid loader to scoop hay into a wagon or pile.
Tipping the skid loader's bucket to discharge hay.
Walking around the hay storage area with the skid loader.
Sitting securely on the hay wagon.
Stabilizing oneself as the wagon moves.
Moving along the barn aisle with the wagon.

tasks.task: Securing hay bales to a wagon.
subtasks: Arranging hay bales on the wagon's floor.
Tying hay bales down using ropes or baling twine.
Checking the security of the tied bales.
Transporting hay bales from an outdoor pile to the barn.
Using a dolly or hoist to move heavy hay bales.
Lifting hay bales into the barn loft or a hay manger.
Distributing hay evenly across the storage area.

tasks.task: Operating a tractor to pull a wagon.
subtasks: Sitting in the tractor driver's seat.
Adjusting the tractor's speed to match the wagon's movement.
Guiding the tractor to ensure the wagon is properly towed.

tasks.task: Using a wire hog on a skid loader.
subtasks: Attaching the wire hog tool to the skid loader.
Operating the skid loader to cut hay with the wire hog.
Managing the direction of the skid loader while cutting.
Separating cut hay from the stalks.

tasks.task: Stacking hay bales in a barn.
subtasks: Aligning hay bales along the intended stacking rows.
Tiltly the hay bale to lift it into place.
Using a forklift or manual lifting to stack bales.
Ensuring the stack is stable and secure.
Identifying the damaged section of the fence.
Removing old fencing materials.
Cutting new fence panels to size.
Nailing or wire fencing panels to the posts.
Securing the new fence with posts and anchors.
Removing manure and bedding from the stall.
Sweeping or brooming the stall floor.
Dumping the unwanted material into a collection wagon.
Disinfecting the stall as needed.
Preparing feed for the animals.
Distributing the feed into the appropriate stalls.
Checking for any refused or leftover feed.
Refilling feeders as necessary.
Setting up the milk feeding equipment.
Heating the milk to the proper temperature.
Pouring the heated milk into the calf's bucket.
Monitoring the calf's intake and behavior during feeding.
Starting the skid steer loader engine.
Driving the skid steer to the designated work area.
Using the control levers to manipulate the bucket.
Lowering the bucket to pick up materials or hay.
Transporting the material to another location.
Lifting the material with the forks or bucket.
Releasing the material at the desired spot.

tasks.task: Handloading hay onto a skid loader.
subtasks: Breaking hay bales by hand.
Placing the hay pieces into the skid loader's bucket.
Operating the skid loader to transport the hay to the barn.
Climbing into the John Deere tractor seat.
Checking controls and safety features before starting.
Starting the John Deere tractor's engine.
Operating the clutch and transmission to move the tractor.
Guiding the tractor to pull a wagon or other implement.
Operating a hay baler or stacker.
Loading hay onto a wagon or directly into a stack.
Moving the stacker to the desired location.
Building the hay stack according to farm standards.
Connecting a trailer or wagon to the tractor.
Loading hay onto the trailer.
Securing the load for transport.
Driving the tractor-trailer to the destination.
Using a scythe or sickle to cut hay by hand.
Bunching the cut hay into manageable piles.
Piling the hay on a wagon.
Getting into the driver's seat of the pickup.
Adjusting mirrors and seat for comfort and safety.
Starting the pickup's engine.
Operating the accelerator, brakes, and steering to drive to the farm areas.
Positioning the collecting device over a hay bale.
Breaking the bale with a tool, possibly a hay bale fork.
Feeding the broken hay into the barrel.
Lowering the cover or door to contain the hay.
Transporting the hay barrel to the storage area.

tasks.task: Loading hay into a flatbed truck.
subtasks: Attaching a flatbed trailer to a pickup or tractor.
Loading hay bales onto the flatbed.
Stacking the hay carefully to prevent shifting.
Securing the load with ropes or nets.
Sorting through hay to remove old or damaged parts.
Breaking up clumps or large pieces of hay.
Packing the hay more tightly into storage.
Diagnosing issues with the skid loader's hydraulic system.
Replacing a damaged component, such as a bucket or forks.
Refilling fluid reservoirs as needed.
Cleaning and maintaining farm equipment before winter.
Applying grease or other lubricants to moving parts.
Covering equipment with tarps or protective sheathing.
Removing debris or excess manure from the spreader.
Power washing or scraping the spreader's surfaces.
Inspecting for wear or damage.
Selecting appropriate sampling tools.
Following a grid pattern to collect soil samples.
Recording sample locations and other data.
Transporting samples to a lab for analysis.
Loading compost onto a spreader or into a truck.
Driving the spreader or arranging the compost for distribution.
Activating the spreader to apply compost evenly.
Managing speed to ensure proper coverage.
Setting the baler according to the desired bale size.
Feeding hay into the baler.
Collecting bales as they are formed.
Stacking or storing the bales.
Setting the depth and width of the tillage implements.
Guiding the tractor as it turns and moves through the field.
Ensuring even coverage and consistent tillage depth.
Attaching a plow to the tractor.
Breaking up soil for planting.
Dealing with obstructions in the soil.
Operating the combine to cut, thresh, and separate crops.
Securing the harvest in the combine's storage.
Cleaning and maintaining the combine during use.
Loading seeds or plants into a planter.
Adjusting planter depth and spacing.
Driving the tractor as it plants the field.
Checking seed placement and overall planter performance.

tasks.task: Driving a skid steer to apply fertilizer.
subtasks: Attaching a撒粪斗 to the skid steer.
Navigating the skid steer through the fields.
Opening and closing valves to distribute fertilizer.
Ensuring even distribution of the fertilizer.
Gathering hay into a pile with a pitchfork.
Using a crow bar to break up large bales if needed.
Positioning the hay in layers to build the stack.
Walking through fields to check for weed growth.
Noting areas needing irrigation or additional care.
Evaluating the maturity of crops for harvesting.
Measuring out appropriate amounts of various fertilizer components.
Combining the fertilizers according to the correct ratio.
Storing the mixed fertilizer until application.
Positioning a hay bale on a baling twine loop.
Wrapping the twine tightly around the bale.
Cutting the excess twine after tying.
Preparing mulch material, such as straw or plastic.
Walking through the field pushing the mulch material over crops.
Ensuring even coverage to protect the plants.
